results.title: RhoA Kinase Inhibition With Fasudil Versus Simvastatin in Murine Models of Cerebral Cavernous Malformations.

results.title: The pathogenetic features of cerebral cavernous malformations: a comprehensive review with therapeutic implications.
results.text_hl: Close focus is directed at @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ model studies involving the @GENE_CCM2 @GENE_216527 @@@Ccm2@@@ gene product signaling pathway, revealing an important role for the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or other @GENE_RHOA @GENE_11848 @@@RhoA@@@ inhibitors as a therapeutic modality in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma_Cavernous_Central_Nervous_System</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020786 @@@CCM@@@.

citations.NLM: Krisht KM, Whitehead KJ, Niazi T, Couldwell WT. The pathogenetic features of cerebral cavernous malformations: a comprehensive review with therapeutic implications. Neurosurg Focus. 2010 Sep;29(3):E2. PMID: 20809760

results.title: Enhancement of autophagy by simvastatin through inhibition of Rac1-mTOR signaling pathway in coronary arterial myocytes.
results.text_hl: However, this inhibitory effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma_Cavernous_Central_Nervous_System</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020786 @@@CAM@@@ proliferation was blocked by by autophagy inhibitor @CHEMICAL_3_methyladenine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C025946 @@@3-methyladenine@@@ or silencing of @GENE_ATG7 @GENE_74244 @@@Atg7@@@ genes.

citations.NLM: Wei YM, Li X, Xu M, Abais JM, Chen Y, Riebling CR, Boini KM, Li PL, Zhang Y. Enhancement of autophagy by simvastatin through inhibition of Rac1-mTOR signaling pathway in coronary arterial myocytes. Cell Physiol Biochem. 2013;31(6):925-37. PMID: 23817226
